lyrics.stanza: If there is no resurrection, God would be God of the dead; Christ Himself would not be living, Ne'er have been raised from the dead.
But there is a resurrection Which is the vitality, Both the life pulse and the lifeline Within God's economy.
If there is no resurrection, Christ a Savior dead would be, Not the One Who lives forever, Who can save most utterly.
If there is no resurrection, There would be no living proof, No proof that justification Was accomplished by Christ's death.
If there is no resurrection, Life imparting would be stayed. And so would regeneration With renewing pass away.
If there is no resurrection, Then whatever would there be? There would be no transformation, Nor to Christ conformity.
If there is no resurrection, Where the members of the Christ? There to Him would be no Body, Which His fullness is in life.
If there is no resurrection, Then the church ne'er have been Which is both to Christ His dear bride And to God the one new man.
If there is no resurrection, Then would be God's economy, With the voiding of His purpose, In collapse fall totally.
